alert.note: Alert for Baker; Bradford; Union (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 9:10PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Bradford, south central Baker and Union Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 910 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sanderson, or 7 miles northwest of Raiford, moving south at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake Butler, Raiford, Palestine Community, Groves, Beasley, New River, Ellerbee, Johnstown and Dukes. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
